titleInfo.title: (PS) Lerma v. California Exposition et al

name.namePart: United States District Court Eastern District of California

titleInfo.title: (PS) Lerma v. California Exposition et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 8/27/12 ORDERING the plaintiff's request for leave to proceed in forma pauperis is granted. Service is appropriate for the following defendants: California Exposition,State Fair Police and Raging Waters. The Clerk of the Court shall send plaintiff one USM-285 form for each defendant, one summons, a copy of the complaint, an appropriate form for consent to trial by a magistrate judge, and this courts status order. Within 14 days from the date of this order, the plaintiff shall provide all appropriate paperwork to the U.S. Marshal. The Clerk to serve a copy of this order on the U.S. Marshal.(Matson, R)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California

(Mena-Sanchez, L)

titleInfo.title: (PS) Lerma v. California Exposition et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 9/24/13 GRANTING 17 Application to Modify Schedling Order: Discovery due by 11/14/2013, Dispositive Motions filed by 10/31/2013, Non-Dispositive Motions filed by 12/15/2013, Final Pretrial Conference RESET for 2/6/2014 at 03:30 PM in Courtroom 3 (KJM) before Judge Kimberly J. Mueller, Jury Trial RESET for 3/17/2014 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 3 (KJM) before Judge Kimberly J. Mueller. (Meuleman, A)

titleInfo.title: (PS) Lerma v. California Exposition et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 10/24/2013 ORDERING that Plaintiff shall appear for her deposition on 11/6/2013 at 10:00 a.m. Plaintiff shall provide answers to all questions regarding her claims and background, with the exception of any privileged information. Plaintiff shall provide responses to all written discovery, including production of responsive documents, on 11/6/2013 at 10:00 a.m. Failure to comply with this order may result in sanctions, including the possibility that this action may be dismissed. (Zignago, K.)

titleInfo.title: (PS) Lerma v. California Exposition et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER to SHOW CAUSE signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 12/3/2013 ORDERING that the 12/12/2013 hearing on defendants' 29 motion for summary judgment is VACATED and will be taken under submission after the time has passed for plaintiff's opposition (and defendants' reply) to be filed. Plaintiff shall file any opposition in accordance with this order, the Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, and the Local Rules by 12/17/2013. Defendants may file a reply brief to plaintiff's opposition, if any, no later than 12/24/2013. (Zignago, K.)

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Kimberly J. Mueller on 2/28/14 ORDERING that Defendants' 11/14/13 MOTION for SUMMARY JUDGMENT 29 is GRANTED, and judgment is entered in favor of defendants. CASE CLOSED. (Mena-Sanchez, L)
